segment.tokens: In consequence of long training the peculiar faculty pointing at game has become an innate quality on their part
young dogs inherit it
they only require that discipline
that discipline is to make
all puppies behave themselves
If we look at a pointer
the first remark naturally arises
the first remark is
that he is a large indolent
He is however extremely affectionate
The black are said
they vary in color
their fur is quite
they are considered very valuable dogs
Mr. Gilpin speaks of a brace of pointers , who stood an hour and a quarter without moving
of a brace of pointers , who stood an hour and a quarter without moving
This however was exceeded Clio a dog
belonging to my father
Clio a dog stood with her hind legs upon a gate for more than two hours with a nest of partridges close to her nose
She must have seen them
as she jumped over the gate
had she moved an inch
they would have been away
My father went on having other dogs
did not miss Clio for a long time
at length he perceived
she was not with the rest
neither came to his call or whistle
he went back to seek her
there she stood
just as she had got over the gate
disturbed the birds
he shot some of them
when thus relieved
Clio was so
that she could not move
her master sat down on the grass
her master rubbed her legs
till she could bend them again
She died of old age
She having been with us fourteen years from her birth
there were no signs of illness
she went out in the morning with the shooting party
The first question on the return of the sportsmen was an inquire for Clio
search was made
she was found quite stiff in the stable
she having apparently come home to die
Of the general intelligence of the pointer the following is a
shooting in Ireland
totally unused to fetch
carry
A gentleman with a dog totally unused to fetch and carry killed a snipe
It fell in soft , boggy ground , where he could not get to pick it up
where he could not get to pick it up
After some vain efforts to approach it he hied on the pointer saying " Fetch it Fan
fetch it "
She seemed for a moment puzzled at such an unusual proceeding
puzzled at such an unusual proceeding
She looked once twice as if to say
round inquisitively
What do you mean
Suddenly the sportsman dilemma seemed to flash upon her
She walked on
She took the bird in her mouth quite gently
She carried it
where the ground was
would
she bring it despite all the encouragement of her master , who now wished to make her constantly
her master now wished to make her constantly
not one inch further retrieve
This however was the first last
she ever lifted
A favourite pointer was lent a gentleman to a friend
after some years of trial finding the dog would not hunt with him
the friend requested his master then in Ireland to receive him back
He was conveyed in a packet from Bristol to Cork
his owner went to meet his dog
The vessel was at some distance from the shore
seeing him on the deck
the gentleman hailed the sailors
the gentleman requested
he might be sent in a boat
No sooner however did
the dog hear his master voice
than he leaped into the water with great demonstrations of joy swam to him on the shore
Such meetings have frequently been too for dogs , who have died from excessive joy at seeing those they loved , after a long absence
dogs have died from excessive joy seeing those
they loved
The sporting dog called the Setter
The sporting dog is by his long , silky hair
The sporting dog has consequently been considered as a large spaniel
The head shews an unusual development of brain
his character for affection and intelligence corresponds with this formation
He is very
is said to have come from Spain to this country his original colour white
He is now marked brown or black having these colours
A gentleman in Ireland received a present of a beautiful black setter puppy from an unknown hand
He bred him
He cherished
the memory of Black York is still in his country not only for his perfect symmetry , his silky , raven black hair his gentle submissive disposition
He was a nervous
alarmed him
young for even a loud word alarmed him combined with his mysterious arrival , and an involuntary affection
when young for even a loud word alarmed him induced his master to transfer him from the kennel to the drawing-room
From that time York acquired confidence
York lost his timidity
he first walked out with the nursemaids and children
he then accompanied his master
The latter went one morning to a rushy field to look at some newly born foals
born
there York pointed to a snipe
The bird rose
The bird pitched some hundred yards away
York nose detected him a second time
he crept on a dozen paces
he couched again
This circumstance betokened his natural perfections
with his temperament the firing a gun might be a dangerous
He was taken day after day to mark the snipes
He praised for his conduct
After this his master took his gun an attendant with orders to the latter
if York should attempt to levant away
York run
he was to catch him in his arms
It occurred
as he had anticipated
poor York was dreadfully
every limb quivered
he was soothed caresses
he encouraged to go
where the dead snipe was lying
In a moment he appeared to comprehend the whole
He smelled the snipe then in his master 's face
He looked at the gun
He became bolder
when he there saw approbation
Another point another shot another snipe York his master returned home
the gun was put in the corner
the snipes close by on the carpet
while his master was drinking his wine
A dozen times York stole quietly to the corner
A dozen times smelled the snipes
A dozen times examined the gun
From that day he gave up
walking with the nursemaids
he became a matchless field dog
